text:
Hello - I am getting following error during sawtooth-core setup. Python, gRPC and tools are installed.... ubuntu@ubuntu-xenial:/project$ /project/sawtooth-core/bin/build_all
--- Running protogen ---

/usr/bin/python3: Error while finding spec for 'grpc.tools.protoc' (ImportError: No module named 'grpc')

A couple of questions: Do you want to be on the master branch? (The docs are for the 0-7 branch(we are working on updating them to make that clear) with the master branch being a reachitecture) If you want to be in the master branch, did you install grpcio-tools using the script sawtooth-core/tools/plugins/install_grpc.sh?

<@U3N0LHYTA> I have thought of something else. Fresh vagrant builds should have the correct grpcio-tools package installed on python3. I have seen where a conf-local.sh script overrode the conf-defaults.sh and so the person didn't get the correct dependencies installed.
I am fine to be on the previous branch initially if that works as per tutorial documentation.

Yeah, checkout the 0-7 branch and that should work with the tutorials. We had a 100+ commit backport PR go into the 0-7 branch on Friday. We ran through all the things we could think of, but let us know if you run into any problems.
